meanings.definition: To scatter or spread over or across something.
meanings.sent1: She will overstrew the seeds in the garden for a beautiful flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The wind will overstrew the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel overstrew the nuts all over the lawn.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to overstrew joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully overstrew paint on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To cover or fill with a scattered layer of something.
meanings.sent1: He decided to overstrew the table with colorful confetti for the party.
meanings.sent2: The snowstorm will overstrew the town with a blanket of white.
meanings.sent3: The chef will overstrew the dish with a sprinkle of herbs for added flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to overstrew warmth in every interaction.
meanings.sent5: The children gleefully overstrew the playground with toys, creating a playful scene.
